div1.p: Legation de Belgique II Division Washington 19 Avril 08

Monsieur le Chevalier
J'ai l'honneur de signaler à votre allentrois toute spéciale le discours que M. Burton Harrison a prononcé hier à la chambre au cours de la discussion du budgets des Affairs Etrangeres-
M. Burton Harrison est dépensé à New York Membre de la commission des Affaires Etrangeres-
Il a pris avec vigueur la défense de l'Administration de l'Etat du Congo l a critqué
l'attitude du Gouvernement americain à cet égard-

Le Député à New York m'a adressé un matin la lettre ci-jointe et je lui ai déjà exprimé person- nellement ma reconnaissance pour le talent avec lequel il vient de soutenir de nouveaux la cause de la justive et de la vérité.
L'attitude de M. Burton Harrison est tout a fait désin- téressée- Il est extrémement ni s'accepte pas d'affaires industrielles du financières- Je n'attend
donc rien en retour de ce qu'il fait pour la défense du Roi et de Son Administration au Congo
Veuillez agreer, Monsieur le Chevalier, les assurances de ma très haute considération

1717, I Street,
Washington, D.C.
April 19th 1908.
My dear Baron Moucheur,

Please accept my best thanks for your kind note and the enclosed clipping from the Belgian newspaper containing a translation of my remarks in the House of Representatives on the Congo. I was very much gratified to see that so much interest was taken in my attitude on the matter.

I am enclosing herewith a leaf from the "Congressional
Record" of yesterday. Containing a further debate in the House on Congo affairs.
I hope that this new presentation of the matter will meet with your approval.

Sincerely yours,
Francis Burton Harrison.

His Excellency
The Belgian Minister.
Legation of Belgium II Division Washington April 19 08

Mister Knight
I have the honor to signal to your allentrois very special the discourse that Mr. Burton Harrison pronounced yesterday to the chamber during the discussion of the budgets of Foreign Affairs-
Mr. Burton Harrison is dispensed in New York Member of the commission of Foreign Affairs-
He took with vigor the defense of the Administration of the State of the Congo he criticized
the attitude of the american government in this regard-

The deputy in New York addressed to me one morning the enclosed letter and I already expressed to him person- ally my recognition for the talent with which he supported the nouveaux the cause of justice and truth.
The attitude of Mr. Burton Harrison is quite disin- terested- He is extremely nor accepts industrial affairs of the finances- Thus I do not expect
anything in return on that which he does for the defense of the King and His Administration in the Congo
Please accept, Mister Knight, the assurances of my very high consideration
